item.label:
The Boncuklu Excavation Module was prepared in 2014 for Dr Andrew Fairbairn, University of Queensland, to record data about the contexts and features excavated at Boncuklu in Turkey.
It is an adaptation of the standard FAIMS Excavation Module, and allows for the single context recording of deposits, which can be grouped into Features.
To login:
1. Choose your user name from the dropdown USERS list. If you do not have a user name see the system administrator; 2. Select the excavation area you wish to record by checking one of circles (radio boxes) on the screen next to the trench you are excavating, denoted by a letter (e.g. H, N, M etc); 3. Press the LOGIN bar. You will now be taken to the context page.
WARNING! If two individuals login as the same user on two different devices, and hit ‘Save’ at the same millisecond, there is risk that the records will be merged during synchronisation. ALWAYS login under the correct username.
For more information, see the Boncuklu Excavation Module Guide. It provides an overview of the features and navigation of the Module.
Help can be found for individual entries by pressing the ? buttons throughout the module.

select1.label: Tap Context ID in list below to load it.
Tap Feature in list below to load it.
Tap Sample in list below to load it.

item.label: Here you can group Contexts into a single {Context_Group}.

select1.label: Select the {Context_Group} to which this Context belongs:

input.label: Use this tab to enter relationships between features. You can record several relationship types, including using standard Harris matrix terms, physical and stratigraphical relationships as in the Boncuklu recording guide. Select the type of relationship on the left, the specified context on the right and click the button 'Relate Features' to record the relationship.

select1.label: Select to Delete or Load the other {Context}

item.label: Here you can enter filenames or unique reference numbers for image stored on another device.

trigger.label: Save and Duplicate {Context} (will not duplicate relationships, samples, or artefacts).

input.label: Use the tab to enter relationships between contexts. You can record several relationship types, including using standard Harris matrix terms, physical and stratigraphical relationships as in the Boncuklu recording guide. Select the type of relationship on the left, the specified context on the right and click the button 'Relate Contexts' to record the relationship.

item.label: Here you can enter filenames or unique reference numbers for image stored on another device.
